body: Also don't forget about the animation stuff we talked about in IRC!

I've pushed a prototype of what I was talking about earlier to e6f06e2fa21fc5dea26ba461658982fc06af714f.  This separates the world logic from rendering, removes most of the places where edge cases can hide in the state logic, and gives some hints on how to fix the wall connection issues.
> OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Buildings/Gate.cs:L15: [SA1505] An opening curly bracket must not be followed by a blank line.
@pchote I incorporated your changes, thank you

Here's some commits to fix the rest of the wall-gate interation issues:
- Support loading `CVec[]` from yaml: 6708c4641d230b5ef03092ea61026d964ab70d3e
- Fix wall adjacency wrt multi-cell footprints: c783c1013c74e9138f58ff7b00fb1fc9f8d370ad
- Fix linebuild adjacency wrt multi-cell footprints: 98236b56366f10537d727b420b88d461f0bdd33a
- Fix gate adjacency wrt multi-cell footprints: a36dacb0b6d9a23175c29f78f596d71f22745545
- Yaml changes to set up the proper wall connections: 5d83ee1d990296bbdfc54ba12932d323af9e926f

The branch with these is https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commits/more-gates

Will merge/rebase that fixup as soon as everything is sorted out
EDIT:
squashed and rebased
I added an IBlocksProjectiles interface to allow linear scaling of blocksprojectiles height as well as disabling the trait (for firestorm gen)
rebased
rebased once again

Has the zoffset been taken into account?

![screen shot 2015-12-16 at 7 52 35 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4861023/11878747/388e5c98-a4bd-11e5-8cd1-20f1a64d55bb.png)
iirc @pchote mentioned that this will be resolved with proper z-buffer sorting
rebased and adapted to @RoosterDragon's requested changes
and fixed my merge conflicts :/

You can fix the sprite overlapping for the open mode

```
        ZOffset: -1c511
```

however that will conflict with the closed mode.

You may need a dynamic Z offset that adapts to the closed and open mode.

> You may need a dynamic Z offset that adapts to the closed and open mode.

This has been discussed multiple times now, and

> iirc @pchote mentioned that this will be resolved with proper z-buffer sorting
rebased and fixed

It does block bullets shot diagonally when gates are open and shouldn't block anything:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/12222140/a28c49f8-b7b3-11e5-9c86-4b1133d7cda7.png)

Looks like bullets can pass closed gates when shot through a straight line:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/12222184/0b32137e-b7b5-11e5-80db-69a39f3573b2.png)
Bullets and other insta-hit projectiles have problems with blocking even on walls. It is still not fixed iirc.
@MustaphaTR: that was fixed in #10243.

Projectiles will be able to pass through the sides of the gate because we do not yet have a way to specify a proper hitbox (see #10349).  This doesn't explain why bullets are blocked by open gates, which is probably a bug.

![screen shot 2016-01-10 at 15 45 39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/12222334/64adb5b0-b7b1-11e5-8b04-ce72f10024d0.png)

Open gates shouldn't block anymore, the other issue is outside of the scope of this pr, as it is an already existing issue (see any line damage projectile missing (big) buildings if it doesn't traverse over the hitbox https://streamable.com/yoma )
Works as promised. :white_check_mark: I consider the path-finding and wall integration very well done. Great work both @teees and @pchote :+1:
Can't the rectangle hitbox solve the footprint issue?
Nope. The rectangle is in screen space.
This already has my (so far implicit) :+1:, and nobody else seems to want to review it so I'll merge this tomorrow if no new review comments are made.
What is with https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9981#discussion_r44780501?

It still derives from the Building class, so all the regular building locks should work as usual I'd guess. It would probably only matter if you want different behaviour for capturing closed and opened gates.

IMO gates count as base defense and shouldn't even be capturable - You are of course free to provide a patch for that in another pr.

TS gates weren't capturable https://github.com/LipkeGu/TSIniFiles/blob/master/rules.ini#L4895

If another mod wishes to have capturable gates, we should make sure that works correctly (or at least make sure it doesn't make bad things happen and leave a TODO somewhere).

I'm not familiar enough with `Locked` to know what needs to happen (if anything) - @penev92 can you clarify?
Will add blocking then, probably tomorrow. Testing it however is tricky, see http://logs.openra.net/index.php?year=2016&month=01&day=17#13:35:12
